alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 11:13PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New Mexico, including the following county, Chaves, to include Roswell. * WHEN...Until 115 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1112 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over and near Roswell. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen in less than 30 minutes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roswell, Bottomless Lakes State Park, Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge and Midway. - This includes the following highways... Highway 380 between Mile Markers 156 and 174. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 97 and 104. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
